template.name: MikroTik CRS326-24G-2S+RM by SNMP
template.description:
The template for monitoring Switch MikroTik CRS326-24G-2S+RM.
24 Gigabit port switch with 2 x SFP+ cages in 1U rackmount case, Dual boot (RouterOS or SwitchOS)
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB MIKROTIK-MIB IF-MIB
Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: High ICMP ping loss
High ICMP ping response time
trigger.description: Average ICMP response time is too high.

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

item.name: Mikrotik: SNMP walk network interfaces
item.description: Discovering interfaces from IF-MIB.

item.name: SNMP walk CPU temperature sensors
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB Discovering CPU temperature sensors.

item.name: SNMP walk temperature sensors
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB Discovering temperature sensors.

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: SNMP walk system CPUs
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB Discovering system CPUs.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Firmware version
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB Current firmware version.

trigger.expression: last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.firmware,#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.firmware,#2) and length(last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.firmware))>0
trigger.name: Firmware has changed
trigger.description: Firmware version has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: Hardware serial number
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB RouterBOARD serial number.

trigger.expression: last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#2) and length(last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber))>0
trigger.name: Device has been replaced
trigger.event_name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Device serial number has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB Physical location of the node (e.g., `equipment room`, `3rd floor`). If not provided, the value is a zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: System name has changed
trigger.description: The name of the system has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB Time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: Operating system
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB Software version.

trigger.expression: last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.sw.os[mtxrLicVersion.0],#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.sw.os[mtxrLicVersion.0],#2) and length(last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.sw.os[mtxrLicVersion.0]))>0
trigger.name: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: The description of the operating system has changed. Possible reasons are that the system has been updated or replaced. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

dependency.name: System name has changed
dependency.expression: last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.name))>0

item.name: SNMP walk mounted filesystems
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB Discovering mounted filesystems.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item.name: Used memory
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: Memory utilization in %.

trigger.name: High memory utilization
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item.name: Mikrotik: SNMP walk Sfp-SfpPlus1-RX
item.description: RX

item.name: Mikrotik: SNMP walk Sfp-SfpPlus2-RX
item.description: RX

item.name: Mikrotik: SNMP walk Sfp-SfpPlus1-TX
item.description: TX

item.name: Mikrotik: SNMP walk Sfp-SfpPlus2-TX
item.description: TX

item.name: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible values: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

trigger_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

discovery_rule.name: Temperature CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlProcessorTemperature Since temperature of CPU is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

item_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB mtxrHlProcessorTemperature Processor temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..).

trigger_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.event_name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available.

trigger_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.event_name: CPU: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available.

dependency.name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold

discovery_rule.name: Temperature sensor discovery
discovery_rule.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlTemperature Since temperature sensor is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

item_prototype.name: Device: Temperature
item_prototype.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB mtxrHlTemperature Device temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..).
Reference: http://wiki.mikrotik.com/wiki/Manual:SNMP

trigger_prototype.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.event_name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available.

trigger_prototype.name: Device: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.event_name: Device: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"Device"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available.

dependency.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n`, then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000` to `n+499,999`. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the operations status is down. 2. `{$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. `last(/TEMPLATE_NAME/METRIC,#1)<>last(/TEMPLATE_NAME/METRIC,#2)` - the trigger fires only if the operational status was up to (1) sometime before (so, does not fire for "eternal off" interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - it will not fire again on the next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) or avg(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) and avg(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.description: The utilization of the network interface is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and max(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate
trigger_prototype.description: It recovers when it is below 80% of the `{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}` threshold.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Space utilization
item_prototype.description: The space utilization expressed in % for Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}.

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} and ((last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} or timeleft(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low
trigger_prototype.event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} and ((last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} or timeleft(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is low
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low
dependency.expression: last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} and ((last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"} or timeleft(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}],1h,100)<1d)

macro.description: Warning threshold of ICMP packet loss in %.
Warning threshold of the average ICMP response time in seconds.
Warning threshold of error packet rate. Can be used with interface name as context.
Used as a threshold in the interface utilization trigger.
Link status trigger will be fired only for interfaces where the context macro equals "1".
Used in network interface discovery rule filters.
Used in network interface discovery rule filters.
Used in network interface discovery rule filters.
Used in network interface discovery rule filters.
Used in network interface discovery rule filters.
Used for network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Filters out `loopbacks`, `nulls`, docker `veth` links and `docker0 bridge` by default.
Used for network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Used in network interface discovery rule filters.
Used in network interface discovery rule filters.
Time interval for the SNMP availability trigger.

trigger.expression: (last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])>0 and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])<10m) or (last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])=0 and last(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/system.net.uptime[sysUpTime.0])<10m)
trigger.name: Host has been restarted

trigger.expression: min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.rx1,5m) > -15 and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.rx1,5m) <= -12 or min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.tx1,5m) > -15 and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.tx1,5m) <= -12
trigger.name: Optical RX/TX Power SFP+1 Average

trigger.expression: min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.rx1,5m) > -25 and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.rx1,5m) <= -16 or min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.tx1,5m) > -25 and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.tx1,5m) <= -16
trigger.name: Optical RX/TX Power SFP+1 High

trigger.expression: min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.rx2,5m) > -15 and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.rx2,5m) <= -12 or min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.tx2,5m) > -15 and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.tx2,5m) <= -12
trigger.name: Optical RX/TX Power SFP+2 Average

trigger.expression: min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.rx2,5m) > -25 and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.rx2,5m) <= -16 or min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.tx2,5m) > -25 and min(/MikroTik CRS326-24G-2SRM by SNMP/walk.tx2,5m) <= -16
trigger.name: Optical RX/TX Power SFP+2 High
